text:
UK democracy is in jeopardy. 

Neither May nor Corbyn can help being so unable to understand other people. 

But they - or their parties -  need very urgently indeed to let others take over their national 'leadership' roles.  

Like, NOW.
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
They both have cognitive challenges and inflexible responses; and they don't understand other people..
Not their 'fault', but makes them totally unsuited to 'leadership'.
When will their parties get a grip on this?  It's very urgent now.
author: HilaryBurrage

text: As a professional social scientist I'd agree - responses are always dependent on the options actually offered.
author: HilaryBurrage

text: She never had it.  Unfortunately neither May nor Corbyn can help being so unable to understand other people, but they - or theiri parties -  do need very urgently indeed to let others take over their 'leadership' roles.

text:
Sorry to have to say this - we agree on much else - but I find Corbyn a desperately sad example of a 'non-flexible' (I'm being polite) and irresponsible 'leader'.   
I did have hope for a while, but I lost that some while ago re Brexit.  
I just can't find a reason to support him
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
So you've actually read the book?

Ah, I guess not.
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
I suppose you think that's clever?

Read the book yourself and then ask again.
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
Have you *actually read* DANGEROUS HERO?

I prefer the Guardian as a source to believe.... 

https://www.theguardian.com/books/2019/feb/20/dangerous-hero-jeremy-corbyn-ruthless-plot-power-tom-bower …

... especially as others who know Corbyn say the book is substantively sound.

PS Lses of the 'aging', please.  I'm older than Corbyn (and, I guess, than you)
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
Wotta surprise (not).  

We can't expect love'n'hugs after our alleged leaders have been so appallingly RUDE to everyone in mainland Europe.

Can't think I'm the only one deeply, grimly embarrassed.  Apologies, M. @EmmanuelMacron 

PS Suppose Corbyn is at his allotment?
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
I fear you are right re the #EURef.
We’re hoping to get lots of support for this petition re the #PublicInquiry into the #EURef
author: HilaryBurrage

text: Special thank you to my 38 new followers from UK., and more last week. http://tweepsmap.com/!HilaryBurrage
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
I’m sure you must all have seen this already

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241848 …

But I hope it’s helpful.

We are nearly at 10,000 and then the Govt will have to respond - which should be interesting?
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
Well, you’re not alone! But it took a while to think out this response.... It seemed so unlikely that almost nothing was being done.

Anyway, please do sign and then share as much as poss. Thanks
author: HilaryBurrage

text:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241848 …

text:
.@Lawyers4EU 
I hope by now you’ll have seen this Petition?

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241848 …

Would obviously much appreciate any support (or advice) etc you can give.  

My first objective is 10,000 signatures so the Govt must respond.

Thanks

Please read and click the link to the Parliamentary Petition 
(And RT  )
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
All v interesting stuff, thx.  You are probably already expecting me to mention the #EURef #PublicInquiry - so here goes

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241848 …

Please everyone sign and then *RT liberally* to get us over the 10,000 mark (in just two weeks). Thanks
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
Petition: #HaltBrexit For A Public Inquiry https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241848 …      
Let’s get to 10,000 ASAP so the Govt must respond!
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
Not so fast.  If the investigation could impact on the result of #EURef itself that’s a material factor. We didn’t know about that at the time.
Why not just support and demand action rather than criticism? 
Let others field lawyer stuff.  Citizen’s duty is to democracy.
Thanksl
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
Surely many of us want to see some assessment of the damage done?

This petition demands a #PublicInquiry into the #EURef:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241848 …
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
And .@OwenSmith_MP 

Corbyn and May are surely both incapable of flexibility or intuitive and perceptive responses? They can’t help it, but it makes them lousy ‘leaders’....
author: HilaryBurrage

text:
Kinda relates to the #PublicInquiry #EURef petition, doesn’t it?  

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241848 …

There must surely be a few MPs willing to follow through on this?  Anyone?

(Please RT ask your own MP, everyone...)

Democracy depends on truth. That must come first.

text: 148 lashes on her body and nearly 4 decades in prison. This is the awful punishment #NasrinSotoudeh will face for peacefully advocating for women’s rights in Iran. But our voices can help shine a light on this horror: Sign this petition to #FreeNasrin
author: HilaryBurrage
